name: B. Pair of Toys
statement:
Tanechka is shopping in the toy shop. There are exactly n toys in the
shop for sale, the cost of the i-th toy is i burles. She wants to choose
two toys in such a way that their total cost is k burles. How many ways
to do that does she have?Each toy appears in the shop exactly once.
Pairs (a, b) and (b, a) are considered equal. Pairs (a, b), where a=b,
are not allowed.
